Graduation Readiness

Prepare now for graduation!

See more here

Challenge your ideas and become a creative and critical thinker at the Wellington Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences.

Our diverse range of courses and location in the nation’s capital and cultural heart will provide you with unrivalled opportunities to build your future.

Explore our schools Contact an adviser

Find us on

Graduation and beyond

Prepare for graduation and your next steps after completing your studies, look at your career options, and find out more about being Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington alumni.

ROLL OF GRADUATES

This roll of graduates lists the qualification details of everyone who has graduated from Victoria University of Wellington from 1998 onwards.

Why you should study with us

#1 in climate action

We rank #1 in New Zealand for Climate Action and Affordable Clean Energy (Times Higher Education—Impact rankings)

Antarctic research

World-leading researchers study how the Antarctic is responding to climate change at the Antarctic Research Centre.

World-renowned experts

Work with some of the world's most renowned scientists and researchers and help tackle climate change and environmental issues.

The Wellington School of Architecture offers a range of postgraduate qualifications, including certificates, diplomas, Master’s programmes, and PhD degrees.

Stand out, get ahead, or change career

Our programmes are tailored to meet the growing needs of the profession while addressing the future demands people have for their built environments. Each qualification offers you the flexibility to tailor your studies to your interests and career aspirations.

Study in 2023

Apply now to start studying in 2023.

Apply now

Find an expert

Enrol for Trimester 3 2022 or 2023

If you are continuing your existing programme, you only need to complete course enrolment. Current students only need to apply for admission if you are starting a new programme.

Important information for 2023 applicants

We’ve made some changes to our system—if you applied for accommodation before 10 September, please check your email and use the link to update your logins to use our new system. Find out more.

More events

Upcoming and current events

  • Exhibitions and Performances
    1 Nov 2022 from 12:00am

    Tapu-gogy: An exploration of pedagogy by Vini Olsen-Reeder

    Can pedagogy exist if it can't be touched? An exhibition by Vini Olsen-Reeder. Classics Museum, Level 5, Old Kirk November–December 2022

    General public Current students Staff Māori Pasifika
More news

Latest news

  • Music researcher Dr Michael David Brown appointed as 2023 JD Stout Fellow

    5 December 2022

    Music researcher Dr Michael David Brown has been appointed as the 2023 JD Stout Fellow. The Fellowship is hosted by the Stout Research Centre for New Zealand Studies at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington.

    This comes from the University's main news page

  • Noelle McCarthy named as 2023 International Institute of Modern Letters Writer in Residence

    28 November 2022

    Bestselling memoirist and well-known radio broadcaster Noelle McCarthy has been appointed as the Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington International Institute of Modern Letters (IIML) and Creative New Zealand Writer in Residence for 2023.

    This comes from the University's main news page

  • International success for linguistics student

    25 November 2022

    This time last year, Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington graduate Luané Lennox was in the middle of her Master of Arts degree in Wellington. Now, Luané is in Montréal, studying a postgraduate programme in linguistics at McGill University.

  • University and Embassy of France working together to support film in Wellington

    22 November 2022

    Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington and the Embassy of France signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) on Wednesday 9 November to establish a new Screen Artist in Residence Programme at the University from 2023.

  • Follow the Light film showcases University talent and history

    9 November 2022

    As part of the University’s 125th anniversary celebrations, a team of staff, students, and alumni came together to create Follow the Light, a film that celebrates the University’s history and the talent of our current University community.

At a glance

Victoria’s research output is used at community, national and international levels. Our academic and business partnerships have global impacts in many fields.
